description: abstract image; rectangular picture plane with large six-sided black form; white triangle in URC; white roughly L-shaped form in LLC
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Edition, Mark and Stamp

LLC on back, in pencil: [EK81-3063]
markings: LLC, in pencil: [AP VII/IX]; LRC, impressed in paper: [© II (inside a circle)]; LLC on back, stamped in grey: [Gemini G.E.L., Los Angeles]
provenance: (Castelli Graphics, New York). (Christie’s, New York, February 12, 2015, sold to Young); (Charles Young Fine Prints and Drawings, Portland, Conn.).
text: Ellsworth Kelly distills the observed and experienced world into abstracted forms or fragments. He articulates these reductive geometric shapes in sculpture, paintings, and prints, by emphasizing their physical and material qualities—size, shape, color, mass, edges, and surface texture. The result, as seen in this monochromatic intaglio print, is elegant in its stark simplicity and conceptual refinement. A prolific printmaker, Kelly has produced more than 300 editioned prints during his seven-decade career.
title: Concorde I
